skill.name: exploratory-data-analysis
skill.description: Perform comprehensive exploratory data analysis on scientific data files across 200+ file formats. This skill should be used when analyzing any scientific data file to understand its structure, content, quality, and characteristics. Automatically detects file type and generates detailed markdown reports with format-specific analysis, quality metrics, and downstream analysis recommendations. Covers chemistry, bioinformatics, microscopy, spectroscopy, proteomics, metabolomics, and general scientific data formats.
skill.summary: Perform comprehensive exploratory data analysis on scientific data files across 200+ file formats. T...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: No credential access, network calls, or external command execution were found. The code reads user-specified files and reference data to generate reports.

content.value_statement: Scientific files are hard to understand before analysis. This skill detects formats, runs targeted checks, and writes a clear markdown report.
actual_capabilities: Detects file type and category from file extension
Loads format-specific reference sections for the detected type
Analyzes common scientific formats like CSV, TSV, JSON, NPY, NPZ, and HDF5
Calculates sequence metrics for FASTA and FASTQ files
Extracts basic image statistics for TIFF, PNG, and JPEG files
Generates and saves a structured markdown EDA report
limitations: Requires optional libraries such as pandas, numpy, h5py, Biopython, or Pillow
Detailed analysis is implemented for a limited set of formats
Large files are sampled for CSV and FASTQ analysis
Does not generate plots or visualizations

use_cases.title: Review sequencing reads
use_cases.description: Summarize read length, quality, and basic QC from FASTQ files before alignment.

use_cases.title: Check experiment tables
use_cases.description: Assess missing values and distributions in CSV or TSV result tables.

use_cases.title: Validate microscopy files
use_cases.description: Inspect image dimensions, channels, and intensity ranges in TIFF stacks.

prompt_templates.title: Quick file check
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze /path/to/experiment.csv and create an EDA report with key issues and next steps.

prompt_templates.title: FASTQ overview
prompt_templates.prompt: Run exploratory analysis on /data/reads.fastq and summarize read length, quality metrics, and recommendations.

prompt_templates.title: Microscopy scan
prompt_templates.prompt: Inspect /data/cells.tif, report dimensions, channels, intensity range, and any quality concerns.

prompt_templates.title: HDF5 structure audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze /data/results.h5, summarize dataset hierarchy, shapes, dtypes, and suggest follow-up analyses.

output_examples.input: Analyze /data/experiment.csv and summarize the data quality.
output: File detected as CSV with 12 columns and 5,000 rows.
Missing values appear in 3 columns, highest in temperature.
Recommend imputation and outlier review before modeling.

best_practices: Provide the full file path and expected file type
Install recommended libraries for the file format
Review the report recommendations before downstream analysis
anti_patterns: Running the tool without access to the data file
Assuming every format has full analysis support
Using results without checking library import errors

faq.question: What file types are compatible?
faq.answer: The skill supports many scientific extensions and provides targeted analysis for common text, array, sequence, and imaging formats.

faq.question: Are there limits for large files?
faq.answer: Yes. CSV and FASTQ analysis samples the first 10,000 records to reduce memory use.

faq.question: Can I integrate this in a pipeline?
faq.answer: Yes. The script supports CLI usage and writes a markdown report to a specified output path.

faq.question: Is my data sent anywhere?
faq.answer: No. The code reads local files and does not perform network calls or data uploads.

faq.question: What if a required library is missing?
faq.answer: The report will include an error message noting the missing dependency and the analysis will be partial.

faq.question: How does it compare to manual EDA?
faq.answer: It provides a fast, standardized overview but may lack domain-specific metrics that a custom analysis would add.
